posts.title: Celebrate Esther Day With These Fantastic YA Books About Friendship and Familial Love
posts.text: Esther Day is a day to tell your friends and family you love them. These titles recognize the importance that friendships and family relationships have in our lives.

posts.title: Bibliobattle: An Alternative Book Club
posts.text: Bibliobattle is a social book review game that could be just the kick in the pants your book club needs.

posts.title: Kickstart Summer With These Young Adult LGBTQ Reads
posts.text: From realistic fiction to science fiction, these protagonists are navigating friendships, romantic relationships, family dynamics and, in some cases, time and space!

posts.title: Great Classroom Additions for Asian American & Pacific Islander Heritage Month
posts.text: If you are a member of the MyLibraryNYC program, you can order some of these books in our Asian Pacific American Heritage Month and Great Books Teacher Sets.

posts.title: Books for Kids & Teens That Nourish Jewish Identity
posts.text: These book all feature Jewish protagonists—celebrating holidays, fighting dragons, writing books, falling in love, attending fan conventions, and more.

posts.title: How to Con!
posts.text: With so many professional conferences and fan conventions each year, we thought it might be helpful to provide some tips and tricks for not only surviving the con, but getting the most out of it at the same time.

posts.title: Wolf, Iron, and Blood: An Alternate History YA Duology from Ryan Graudin
posts.text: What if Hitler won World War II? Alternate history recommendations for teen readers.

posts.title: 5 Poems to Read Aloud for All Ages
Five YA Books You Seriously Need to Read
posts.text: It doesn't matter what you normally read. Whether it's science fiction, fantasy, romance, non-fiction... these are books that you seriously need to read right now.
